DataElement.preferredName: Patient Agent Adverse Event Torsades De Pointes Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to elements of a patient'smedical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial from agent with accepted risk of causing an atypical rapid polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with a characteristic rotation of the QRS complex around the isoelectric baseline.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Agent Adverse Event Torsades De Pointes Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to elements of a patient'smedical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial from agent with accepted risk of causing an atypical rapid polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with a characteristic rotation of the QRS complex around the isoelectric baseline.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Agent Adverse Event Torsades De Pointes Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:An atypical rapid polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with a characteristic rotation of the QRS complex around the isoelectric baseline. In addition the QRS complex displays a periodic waxing and waning of amplitude on the electrogram. (NCI):Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.longName: Torsades De Pointes by ECG Finding
Concepts.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of an atypical rapid polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with a characteristic rotation of the QRS complex around the isoelectric baseline, occurring in the setting of a prolonged QT interval. In addition, the QRS complex displays a periodic waxing and waning of amplitude on the electrocardiogram.
Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Any of the following Category
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following Category I drugs that are generally accepted to have a risk of causing Torsades de Pointes <=7 days prior to registration: Quinidine, procainamide, disopyramide; Amiodarone, sotalol, ibutilide, dofetilide;  Erythromycin, clarithromycin; Chlorpromazine, haloperidol, mesoridazine, thioridazine, pimozide; Cisapride, bepridil, droperidol, methadone, arsenic, chloroquine, domperidone, halofantrine, levomethadyl, pentamidine, sparfloxacin, lidoflazine

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient discontinued and agreed to sustain from using any medications that have a known risk of Torsades de Pointes (see Appendix IV) 14 days prior to starting OSI-906, during treatment with OSI-906 and until 7 days after final treatment with OSI-906

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following Category I drugs that are generally accepted to have a risk of causing Torsades de Pointes <=7 days prior to registration: Quinidine, procainamide, disopyramide; Amiodarone, sotalol, ibutilide, dofetilide; Erythromycin, clarithromycin; Chlorpromazine, haloperidol, mesoridazine, thioridazine, pimozide; Cisapride, bepridil, droperidol, methadone, arsenic, chloroquine, domperidone, halofantrine, levomethadyl, pentamidine, sparfloxacin, lidoflazine; Prochlorperazine
